findings.title: Quorum too low for meaningful governance
findings.description: Quorum is only 1000 tokens. A single whale can meet quorum and pass arbitrary proposals without broad consensus.
findings.impact: Hostile governance takeover by single actor.
findings.recommendation: Set quorum as percentage of total/circulating supply (e.g., 4-10%). Use snapshot-based voting.

findings.title: No timelock on proposal execution
findings.description: Proposals execute immediately after voting ends. No time for community to detect and respond to malicious proposals.
findings.recommendation: Add minimum 24-48 hour timelock between voting end and execution.

findings.title: No proposal validation - arbitrary targets allowed
findings.description: Proposals can target any contract with arbitrary calldata. No whitelist or sanity checks.
findings.recommendation: Limit proposal targets to known safe addresses or require higher thresholds for arbitrary calls.
